دمشق دنیا میں سب سے پرانا مسلسل آباد شہر: What is the oldest continuously inhabited city in the world? Damascus oldest continuously inhabited city

Damascus, Syria Founded in 3000 B.C.E., Damascus is considered by many to be the oldest continuously inhabited city in the world and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It became an important cultural center and major trading city because of its position at the crossroads of Asia and Africa.
What is the oldest continuously inhabited city in the world? Damascus oldest continuously inhabited city

Damascus is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world. First settled in the 3rd millennium BC, it was chosen as the capital of the Umayyad Caliphate from 661 to 750. After the victory of the Abbasid dynasty, the seat of Islamic power was moved to Baghdad.
